creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: farming scenes: at R, man stands near the center of a small field with a seed bag strapped around shoulder, spreading seeds; another man at LRC chops at one of the many trees along R edge; at L, a man plows a field with three horses, while a figure with a whip sits on the rear horse; a ram surrounded by clouds at center separates the two scenes
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

in graphite on verso: P 2896 | G44 (1-2) or (1-7) | 1802 (circled) | B.IX.448.27
markings:
blue stamp on verso, far left: Dr. K.O., not in Lugt (possibly Dr. Karl Max Osthof); two stamps in black at left and left of center, respectively: British Museum Printroom, Lugt 302 (with date of 10.12.46 stamped in mark) and Lugt 305 (with Campbell Dodson initials inside mark); stamp of Hugo Ahne, Aussig, to right of center, not in Lugt* 

* Possibly the same collector born Vienna 1875, died Munich 1964, who focused on small Renaissance graphics from Nuremberg, per \"Knizni Znacka,\" March 2014.
provenance: Hugo Ahne; Dr. K.O. (possibly Dr. Karl Max Osthof); British Museum Printroom duplicate, apparently as of October 12, 1946; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until August 9, 1983; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Month of March with Aries, From Twelve Months with Signs of the Zodiac
